content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

The main target image shows a toy-like vehicle structure made of various building blocks. Let me break down the structure in detail:

## Count & Layers:
- The structure has 7 blocks in total
- There are 3 main layers:
  - Bottom layer: Two orange cylindrical blocks (wheels)
  - Middle layer: Two yellow rectangular blocks (base)
  - Top layer: One red arch block (cabin) and one orange triangular block (roof)

## Spatial Relationships:
- Bottom layer: Two orange cylindrical blocks are placed horizontally, parallel to each other, forming the wheels of the vehicle
- Middle layer: Two yellow rectangular blocks are placed horizontally on top of the cylindrical wheels, forming a platform/base
- Top layer: A red arch block (with a semicircular cutout) is placed on top of the yellow base, positioned toward the right side
- An orange triangular block is positioned on top of the red arch block, forming a roof

# Required Blocks from the Dictionary

Based on my analysis, I need the following blocks from the dictionary:

1. Block #12 - Orange horizontal cylinder (right wheel)
2. Block #13 - Orange horizontal cylinder (left wheel)
3. Block #7 - Yellow horizontal rectangular block (front base)
4. Block #10 - Yellow horizontal rectangular block (rear base)
5. Block #1 - Red arch block with semicircular cutout
6. Block #15 - Orange triangular block (roof)

# Assembly Order

Here's the step-by-step assembly sequence:

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 12
    Step2: Move block with index 13
    Step3: Move block with index 7
    Step4: Move block with index 10
    Step5: Move block with index 1
    Step6: Move block with index 15
}
```

This assembly order starts with placing the wheels (bottom layer), then adding the base platform (middle layer), followed by the cabin and roof (top layer) to complete the vehicle structure.
